items.content_html:
Summary

None of those methods return an Array nor an ArrayIterator.

I wasn't sure how to handle @@asyncIterator, I got inspiration from https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array.

Motivation

The current state is not aligned with the spec, not the Chromium implementation.

Supporting details

Refs: https://wicg.github.io/file-system-access/#api-filesystemdirectoryhandle

Adjusts the iframe height for some live samples. Also fixed a heading to use sentence case.
items.title: Fix issue 13506: adjust example iframe height

items.content_html:
Summary

The Headers constructor accepts an array of name-value pairs, where each pair is a 2-element string array, in place of a bare object or another Headers object and it should be represented on the docs.

Motivation

In situations where multiple headers of the same name exist in a headers object, this documentation update provides users an alternative to headers.append() calls.

Supporting details

There already exists an example of using a 2d string array on this page: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers but it is not called out in the constructor documentation.

https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#typedefdef-headersinit

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

Note: I am not sure which metadata buttons should be checked here, so I checked 2 that could apply.
items.title: docs: Add documentation around `Headers` constructor init arg as an array of name-value pairs, where each pair is a 2-element string array

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump @mdn/yari from 0.6.84 to 0.7.1

items.content_html:
Summary

I wrote that prefixed version is no longer relevant and non-standard values no longer work. I also changed example to something that actually has visual effect.

Motivation

appearance property had plenty of informations that are no longer relevant, as unprefixed version is now supported on all modern browsers and non-standard values no longer work.

Supporting details

Standard, Chromium group chat

Related issues

In changes I have removed description of menulist-button which was incorrect. I think that feature together with textfield is not supported yet, as I couldn't see anything that specification wrote about. The only change with menulist-button that I could see, is that on Safari arrow keys are shown in middle of text in presented interactive examples, which seems to be a bug.

items.title: fix Element.shadow example bug

items.content_html:
This note is intended to clarify the policy in the Learning Area for the "modernity" of the JS we teach. It should express that:

  1. we teach "modern JS", as long as a feature is stable and well-supported
  2. we do this because we think it's important for people to learn "the new way" as the primary way of doing things
  3. this will only be a problem if you have to support obsolete browsers: if you do, we recommend using (something like) Babel, and still writing modern JS.
items.title: Add a note about our policy for teaching modern JavaScript

items.content_html:
Part of #10337, the project to modernize the JS Learning Area.

This is the seventh (and last!) PR that updates the final module, Client-side web APIs. It makes minor updates to the fifth article, Client-side storage.

This PR has a corresponding PR in mdn/learning-area: both PRs should be merged together, and changes in one will need corresponding changes in the other one. For that reason I'm marking it draft, although it is ready for review.
items.title: JS Learn: update client-side APIs, part 7

items.content_html:
Fixes #13356

Use correct syntax and provide better context in example

Summary

Update code under Examples to use correct syntax and provide better context on how the API works.

Motivation

Primarily Issue #13356, but also made some changes to provide context on how appending the custom element to a form updates it's internals' form property to point to the parent form.

This also fixes the selector that was being used incorrectly: let element = document.getElementById("custom-checkbox"); which makes the console.log() work.

Supporting details

  • Issue with "ElementInternals": syntactically wrong code example
  • HTML Standard - The CustomElementRegistry interface
  • MDN CustomElementRegistry.define()

items.title: Fix syntax in code example in ElementInternals article

items.content_html:
Summary

As we are going to deprecate the existing client hint Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version, using Sec-CH-UA-Full-Version-List instead.
This change is going to update the document for Javascript API NavigatorUAData.getHighEntropyValues() to return a list of brand information containing browser name and full version number.

Motivation

This change helps our long-term goal to depreacate uaFullVersion, it helps users to start use fullVersionList .

Supporting details

  • https://wicg.github.io/ua-client-hints/#interface
  • https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1260418
  • #10906
  • https://user-agent-client-hints.glitch.me/javascript.html

Related issues

WICG/ua-client-hints#196.

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: update gethighentropyvalues client hints options and example

items.content_html:
Fixes #13422 - clarifies meaning of 'static text content' vs 'dynamic content' - the former refers to the type of content (non-interactive), while the latter refers to how/when the content is displayed.

Summary

On the a11y Slack, @ashleemboyer highlight the apparent contradiction between these two sentences:

  • "The alert role should only be used for static text content."
  • "The most important thing to know about the alert role is that it's for dynamic content.

She raised #13422 to document this issue.

Motivation

To help readers better understand:

  • What type of elements the alert role should be used on.
  • In what contexts the alert role should be used.

Related issues

#13422

Supporting details

Explanation from @backwardok on the a11y Slack:

Here’s my understanding of the sentences (although I think it’s confusingly written):

  • “The alert role should only be used for static text content.“: Don’t put interactive elements in here, only text
  • “The most important thing to know about the alert role is that it’s for dynamic content.“: Don’t add content to an alert role on page load, since it’s going to announce when it’s shown. Content should be added to an alert role container when relevant

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: ARIA alerts: clarify meaning of static vs dynamic

items.title: Fixed a typo

items.content_html:
Summary

Add short mention to the SubtleCrypto.verify docs that the signature is expected to be in IEEE P1393 format for ECDSA.

Motivation

The DER signature format being used by OpenSSL / X509 and Node.js Crypto, while the WebCrypto standard being r+s aka IEEE P1393 makes for a very confusing experience at their intersection! While Node.js is able to generate and verify p1393 signatures, it would still be helpful to have this noted here so the requirement is understood!

Supporting details

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39554165/ecdsa-signatures-between-node-js-and-webcrypto-appear-to-be-incompatible
  • https://www.w3.org/TR/WebCryptoAPI/#ecdsa-operations

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Mention that ECDSA signatures are in IEEE P1393 format

items.content_html:
Summary

I have mentioned outline-offset, border-radius affecting outline angles and gave more details about non-rectangular shape of an outline.

Motivation

Statement that outline property sets "all" outline related features was misleading.
Default value of outline-color has been corrected.
I believe mentioning outline-offset and border-radius on that page will give users wider understanding about what we can do with outline.
Last change is related to non-rectangular shape of an outline. Previous note was very vague.

It's my first pull request, everything looks to be alright?

Supporting details

I have mentioned that default value of outline-color can be "invert", which can be checked in https://drafts.csswg.org/css-ui/#outline-color and https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/outline-color#formal_definition

In changes I have also stated that border-radius is affecting edges of outline. Linked specification mentiones "To the extent that the outline follows the border edge, it should follow the border-radius curve.".

Last notable difference was about non-rectangular shape of an outline. It is mentioned in linked specification in sentence "The parts of the outline are not required to be rectangular. ". It can be verified by following markup: <div style="width: 200px"><span style="outline: 1px solid blue">Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit.</span></div>
On Google Chrome single line wraps whole text, while on firefox, separate lines surround each line box.

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Few changes to outline.
